intro: Sida trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that have three distinct veins. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom throughout the growing season. Sida trinervia is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
